qas.question: Following what event was it uncertain if Shell would recommence drilling?
In February 2013, Shell Corporation announced that it would pause what?

answers.text: its closely watched drilling project off the Alaskan coast

qas.question: Shell Corporation announced what in January 2014?

answers.text: the extension of the suspension of its drilling program in the Arctic

qas.question: Which Shell Corporation executive explained the reason for the January 2014 announcement?
What reason did the executive give for Shell's January 2014 announcement?

answers.text: the project is "under review" due to both market and internal issues.

qas.question: What project was based in Alaska?
When did van Beurden become the chief executive?
When was the original suspension of the drilling program?
When did shell announce it was resuming it Alaskan project?

plausible_answers.text: due to both market and internal issues

qas.question: Why was van Beurden under review?

context: It was unclear if Shell would recommence drilling in <b7_0>mid-2013<b7_0/>, following <a0_0><b5_0>the "Kulluk"<b5_0/> incident<a0_0/> and, in February 2013, the corporation stated that it would "pause" <a1_0>its closely watched drilling project off the Alaskan coast<a1_0/> in <b8_0>2013<b8_0/>, and will instead prepare for future exploration. In <b6_0>January 2014<b6_0/>, the corporation announced <a2_0>the extension of the suspension of its drilling program in the Arctic<a2_0/>, with chief executive <a3_0>van Beurden<a3_0/> explaining that <a4_0>the project is "under review" <b9_0>due to both market and internal issues<b9_0/>.
